title: Steve Hansen putting faith in form over pedigree in bid to prolong his time as New Zealand head coach
text:
The stakes have never been higher for Steve Hansen. On Saturday, his horse, Nature Strip, runs in The Everest, a prestigious Sydney sprint race with a prize pool of £7.4m five hours before the All Blacks take on Ireland in a World Cup quarter-final in what could be his last game as New Zealand head coach.

As defending champions, the All Blacks are the clear thoroughbreds of this competition and have been given a 12-point handicap by most bookmakers against Ireland. Yet that 2015 side was dripping with experience. The 10-12-13 combination of Dan Carter, Ma’a Nonu and Conrad Smith alone accounted for 393 caps.
